creator: bugmenot@lortemail.dk
sebb@apache.org
text:
[ and ] are Regex meta-characters, and need to be escaped by the user, not 
JMeter.

Ok, so how do I escape these characters from the UI?  I tried:

member\[33\]

which allowed the regex to work properly, but the parameter was submitted on the
next page as:

member%5C%5B0%5C%5D

which the app will see as literally as member\[33\].  The only way I was able to
get this to work was to escape the brackets only when it is put into regex which
has to happen in the URLRewritingModifier class.
creator: bugmenot@lortemail.dk
sebb@apache.org
text:
Sorry, I was wrong - the HTTP URL Re-writing Modifier is not intended to be 
used with parameters that contain regular expressions, so I agree you should 
not need to quote them.

The parameter is supposed to be the name of the session identifier - so are 
you saying that the session identifier looks like "member[33]" ?

If so, can you give an example? Please include the immediate context (don't 
need the whole page).

This is so I can create a test for it.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text: This was fixed in SVN commit r513558
